text: Good food at a good price, we come at least 2 times a month. The Ropa Borja sandwich is good

Omg! Bomb.com! Love how they have it completa style which means great portions at cheap prices! East coast style!! I had lechon asado with congri and side salad and plantano maduro for 7.00.. plus I had mamey batido which was perfect to taste not too sweet and chilled. Plus my company had cuban sandwich and other completas like pollo frito and picadillo with white rice and black beans. They said is delicious as well.. I had to travel from North town which is quite a distance but worth the travel for a delicious hearty meal.
They say they close at 7 they do not they close at 6:30 we tried to order to go pickup but they said they are closed. Why do they say at 7 when it's not at 7? Not a huge fan of restaurants that lie

Best Comido Cubano I've had in Las Vegas, the Ropa Vieja is marvelous and well spiced, the black beans and white rice are perfect compliments, don't forget the fried plantains, a simple small hole in the wall place in a strip mall, family run, great home cooking, pork, beef, chicken, and the service is impeccable, a must try before it gets too well known, which won't be long

Actually, it's 4 stars at best. However, Vegas needs more places like this and I'm grading on a sliding scale that incorporates the fact that this is a hole in the wall. 

Prices: Fantastic (likely to go up a little in the future I would guess)

Tamales were a dollar a piece. A full plate of food was $7. That came with a meat, a rice side (white rice and black beans or them mixed together), choice of starch: fried plantain (sweet chunks or thin, savory chips) or mojo de yucca (tender yucca in oil and onion), and a tiny salad dressed nicely with avocado. Yes, that's FOUR items for 7 bucks. The sammys were 6 to 7 bucks and come with fries which they would sub in another starch side upon request.

Food: Great all the way down to bad.

The sides are awesome here. If you have had Cuban food before and get dizzy with excitement thinking of the beans and rice or fried plantains, you are going to be stoked. My Cuban sandwich was also pretty good. I thought the tamales were a little sweet but my wife loved them. Think steamed corn bread. My wife didn't love her steak and my mom's pork was DRY beyond excuse. Really dry and bad and should not have been served. My advice to the owners would be to not do that. If you know it's old and bad, just say you're out. In the long run, it will pay off. There's something to be said about slow roasting for hours, but you don't wanna cold rest it for days. It may have been an off night though. Also, like my wife mentioned, what do you want for $7 really?

Place:

Shopping mall, hole in the wall that is literally family-run. You got the son taking orders, the sister bringing out the food, and the mom asking if it was good. Could be cousins and aunts or something, but you get the idea. 

I don't live in Vegas anymore, and I don't know when I'll be back. However, I hope this place has a long life in Vegas. We need more places like this. Even though we have awesome Mexican food (I'm looking at you D-bag who said Mexican food was disgusting), we could use a little more variety in Latin food.

On a second and third visit to El Tinajon I found that
the Cuban meals were much better and tastier than
on my first visit. Whereas previously I had rater this
eatery a (1), upon my 2nd visit I Upgraded it to a (3).
On my 3rd and last visit this past week I liked it more,
where I now give it a weak 4 (a HUGE improvement
from my first visit). I now  rate highly their tamales,
ropa vieja, mamey shakes, and bistek encebollado.
Good food, good price.  Yummy shakes.  The restaurant is small. Very clean. Limited selection. Kinda like eating at my aunts house.

The service is bad. I used to go often since it was near the gym. I asked the owner to if it was ok to put my business cards. She said yes, "I actually I was looking for this service". So I left my expensive business cards out there. They actually look like credit cards. A week later a guy name (Andrew Parsley) that are partners with the owner, said he wanted my services. I went to his office, he was not there but his assistance tried to sell me on a weekly ads at the restaurant. At this point, the owner of the restaurant and Andrew just wanted my time. Please be careful, this is a big scam. I get the part of trying to sell your product but do not make me waste my time and gasoline. I'm taking them to small claim court for my business cards since I have not got them back.
Excellent food!   The Cuban sandwich was great and the lunch special was a perfect way to taste different Cuban foods.  Tons of great food and super affordable!

Never been before but I must say it was good as I ordered different selections & each was good in flavor & portions. 
Very inexpensive

I have recently found a craving for Cuban Food and I am glad a friend took me to EL Tinajon. This is very much a family owned restaurant with a simple menu and small eating area. I have gotten several things from the menu and have tried the Cuban Tamales and all have been great tasting. The speed of the food is quick and the staff and customer inside are al nice and which make this place inviting.

Man this places is so good.  Meal special was 8 dollars.  I got the salteado steak with black beans and rice and garlic and onion cassava.  I had to order a side order of crispy tostones and tamales with roasts onions on top. I judge a place based on the food first and foremost. I would expect to pay triple what I paid if it was in a foo foo frilly restaurant.  But this place is a classic family run small restaurant.  You order at the register they bring it out.  The black beans were awesome.  Perfectly spiced and great over the rice.  If you are up to food adventures this place is great. They even had a fruit drink called Mameya that was made fresh to order.  It's a fruit I have never had and I have tried tons before.  I am going to come here and eat through the whole menu.

I don't know why people are giving this place 4-5 stars. Because of that today I went to this horrible place. The food was lukewarm and tasted rancid, my husband and I barely ate. We got a fruit shake and it was pure sugar no fruit taste at all. This has to be by far the WORST Cuban restaurant in Las Vegas. Only reason we went was because all this great reviews that I doubt are true, this must be friends and family of the restaurant because no one in their right mind would consider this dog food edible. Sure enough a few hours after we got home I was violently sick! Sorry to be graphic but this "amazing food" was coming out of both sides. I would give this zero stars but unfortunately i have to give it one. Yes it's cheaper than the rest of the Cuban places in Vegas (probably due to their LOW quality food) but trust me spend the extra $3 and get yourself a decent meal.

Friendly staff, family owned.
I come here for their Cuban sandwiches almost every week. Simple yet very filling.

Well we went here still looking for good Cuban food in Las Vegas. We were extremely disappointed. I ordered roasted pork loin and my wife had the steak and onions. Both were under seasoned and way over cooked. My pork loin was like eating leather. My wife asked for extra onions and it did not happen so I gave her mine. We are accustomed to a thick mayo like based garlic sauce in the Cuban restaurants in Seattle. We ordered garlic sauce but recieved a mixure of saut√©ed apples, onions and garlic in a cup. The salad we got looked like what you would receive as sides for a hamburg. No one ever came to ask how our meal was or if we needed anything. The lady who took our order did scream from the back asking if it was good as we walked out. I said thanks. Only positive note I could come up with was the black beans were good with lots of seasoning and bacon.

Yes, you need to go here. I don't know who you are but that doesn't matter. El Tinajon is a place everyone should eat at.  Authentic Cuban food at its, well, most authentic- which means delicious. Ham& cheese croquettes? Yes, they have them and they're divine. Fried pork? Also divine. Everything pork - delicious goodness. Stop by, give it a try and I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

This place has very good pricing. You come in thinking it's going to be good authentic food, but everything comes out super cold like it's literally been sitting for the whole morning with absolutely no flavor.
Food its always  good. But they need to train the two cashiers on customer service skills and how to be organized

I love the Tamales best in town! 
Excellent Cuban style food! 
Thanks for being in Vegas!!!

Some of the best Cuban food here in Las Vegas, other than going to my Tia Andreas house but your not invited there so this will do for you guys lol. I've tried the tamales which are made of corn and stuffed with ham. Definitely should try ropa vieja (old clothes) it's shredded steak with tomato sauce very flavorful, served with congris (rice mixed with black beans), yuca with onions and a salad. Everything I've tried is very delicious and reasonable prices.

The Cuban sandwiches here are EXCELLENT! Extremely authentic pan con croquetas with a thick slice of cheese on the sandwich. It's only $3 with French fries included!!!! The fries here are so delicious and crispy and homemade. If you come here, I recommend getting smoothies $2.50 of guayaba (guava) and the mamey. They're creamy and full of authentic flavor. Try the soup too. Everything here is either really at a reasonable price or cheap. Nothing is overprice and portion is really large too. They also have Cuban tamale $1, thought it was under-seasoned but great texture. I know what Cuban food should taste like because I have a Cuban girlfriend and I always eat homemade Cuban food. This is like A1 since there are not a lot of Cuban restaurants this side of the time. This place looks unnoticeable at first but if you sit in there, it's really busy here. I would definitely recommend for yelpers to try new flavor at this place :)

First time here with a friend. I wanted to order a sandwich Cubano but they were not serving it or they ran out of it. So I ordered the tamales. Since everyone kept ordering them. With the rice and beans. It didn't take long for the food to come out. Everything was fresh and good. There's big chunks of chicken in the tamales. They're not expensive either everything is pretty much reasonable. The rice was good as well. There's a cool mural of Cuba, and great music to enjoy with your food.
Great price for a big plate . However food was not hot , it came to me cold. Not a very good experience. Also not to flavorful the food was missing spices.

Was craving some Cuban food like in Miami and found this place online. It's pretty darn close to Miami style Cuban food and mehn those large portions! Yes or like the Cubans say it "Oye"'! Had the pork chunks with white rice and red beans on the side with Tostones and salad. The pork chucks were large and succulent. The rice and beans were cooked well and the Tostones...oh how I missed Tostones! Fried perfectly golden and not too done. The young girl at the desk is very friendly and hospitable. I will be back again!

El Tinajon was very good at the beginning for me. However, the l last two visits, the order was horrendous. I used to order the steak, but after the last order, I stopped. The steak was dry with no flavor. I decided to give the restaurant another try. Today,  I ordered rice/beans and pork, the pork had no flavor, the black beans was watery and again, no flavor. I don't think I will be going back.

I just discovered this place yesterday and I'm obsessed. Their meals are delicious and cheap. They offer a whole meal for $7! They charge $1 for a piece of flan, which is also great. I'm so used to Cuban food being so expensive, it's great to know that places like this exist. They run out of food quickly, so you gotta get there early. I tried going at 6:30 and all they had were tamales left.

Terrible place ... no prices on menu..in fact no menu except what's written on board.    
I ordered chicken, rice and bean combo and plantains... all were tasteless ... the place is a far cry from la's Versailles ... 
and it's dirty to boot..
Not good, barely acceptable ...

Due to the fact of being Cuban, coming from Miami, living there for 32 years. I will definitely know how Cuban food taste and looks. Today Halloween day at 2:43 I am siting right now on the table 10/31/2017, all I can say is that my steak was cook from the previous day or from another customer. I had two pieces of steak on my plate one was fresh and the other one wasn't. I couldn't eat it.

So happy there is a Cuban Spot in the neighborhood! It's a small place with BIG flavor! There are a few high top tables and chairs for people who want to dine in. I decided to order to go. I ordered the Ropa Vieja, which came with side salad made up of shredded lettuce, tomatoes and avocados, a side of fried bananas, and black beans and rice. I also ordered a Cuban Sanwich and an Iron Beer for a friend, the total bill was under $20.00 - tip included. Everything  was amazing. I honestly felt like I was eating my grandmas (Mima's) cooking. Everything was perfect! I really didn't expect much since it's a pretty new business, in a small shopping center in the back next to Smart and Final. The place does not look like much, a little hole in the wall Cuban spot that I am glad I found! This will definitely be a regular spot for me.

Food is ok.,... I've tried ropa vieja and Cuban sandwich. My first visit I ordered Cuban sandwich. It was good, so I ordered on different occasion ropa vieja. I was super hungry when I ordered ropa vieja, so I tried to eat enough to stop feeling like I wasn't starved and tossed the rest. Unfortunately probably the worst tasting ropa vieja I've ever had. Thought on 3rd visit I'd stick to what I had ordered before since it was good. This time not as good. People are nice and being small family owned business I really wanted to give them my business but can't say I'm too impressed with the taste. Every visit I ordered to go. Not sure if I'll continue to order there. Hopefully taste improves.

Amazing, authentic Cuban Food

Being born in Miami Beach, it's cool to see something like this in Las Vegas

Wish this place was closer to me! For the cost of a fast food combo ($7), you can get a fresh ingredient meal consisting of a meat (choices including steak, fried chicken, shredded beef), salad, rice, beans and a side (i.e., plantains, yuca). Service was fast and friendly. Our take-out order included delicious croquetas de jamon (4 for $3), a sizeable steak sandwich ($6 included fries) and a entree with masitas de puerco. All was excellent!
Very authentic, employees are awesome. The food is a little below par for anyone who grew up Cuban but worth trying.

Cada vez q vea este lugar en cualquier pag web seguire diciendo q me encanta !!! ,te sientes como en casa y q decir de esos tamales (Dios ) aqui en SD no hay d esos ,muchas gracias por traer los sabores de mi tierra de vuelta a mi ,ustedes son lo maximo y espero verlos en diciembre nuevamente

This is the ONLY authentic Cuban food myCuban wife and I have ever had in Vegas and we have tried them all.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because they messed up my order.  I ordered Vaca Frita but got Ropa Vieja but the ropa vieja was so good I didn't send it back ;-).  Good food,  good price and the restaurant is clean.

It's hard to fine Cuban food in Vegas with authenticity. Definitely this is the right spot. Roasted Pork and Cuban Tamales has the real taste. Simply love it! Only thing they need to improve is supply. This is not Cuba! You can't running a business with shortage. If you ask for something in the menu should be there

Listen, it's a hole in the wall. Is it as good as my mom's cooking? Can anyone's cooking be better than my mom's? Nope, but the food is good, and the tamales are delicious. If you're craving Cuban food, this is the place to be. I drive all the way from the north west to come here.

Where to start.  Walked in and found a quaint small place.  Very few tables to sit at.  The menu board was not great, kinda scared me away a bit.  But said I'm here so let's give it a try.

That said, the young lady at the register was very nice and inviting.  I was very pleasantly surprised at the prices.  In Miami I'm use to my meal being Rice and beans, meat and plantains or yuca.  Most places in town it's just Rice and beans and meat the plantains or yuca are extra.  Well this place was like Miami and that makes me happy.

I had the Ropa Vieja with Rice & Beans and Yuca.  A t amal, and 4 ham croquets total was 15.   Unlike a recent visit to another place in town with smaller petitions and was 24 for same thing minus the croquets...  Yet I was criticized for the review about that place cause I thought was expensive and bad portions.

Oh well I can tell you I will be going back for sure... Check it out see what you think, I'm sure you will like it.

Was in the area over the weekend taking classes nearby, didn't feel like the ordinary so looked up to see what was nearby. Saw Cuban and the positive reviews, so immediately headed over. Ironically, this restaurant is two doors down from where I've been getting my taxes done for a decade. Who knew? Inside, El Tinajon is your typical hole in the wall restaurant. Started to order a Cuban sandwich, but they were out of ham and wouldn't be able to make one for at least an hour. I ordered some kind of Lechon (Lomo maybe?) Asado with Rice and Beans (mixed) and platano maduro to go. Headed back to my class, and sort of tentatively pulled out the to go container - prepared to be underwhelmed. What a meal. The pork was tender, juicy and had a handful of crispy pieces. I shoveled in fork after fork of the rice and beans. Holy hell this was some seriously good pork, and arroz y frijoles. And the fried plantains....let's just say; I'm glad no one could see me in my car, eating this meal like a ravenous vagabond. I will definitely make my way by here again when I'm on the east side!
I don't even know what to say. The food here was awful. I had a Cuban sandwich that was almost inedible. Never again.

Batido de Mamey..
Muy Rico...
Cafe Cubano uno dollar 
Pastelitos yum yum ...
A great place for a little snack or the whole pig roast...
Best Cuban food in Las Vegas! Great service and great price. Authentic Cuban flavor.

Great food I will come again. I ordered Ropa Vieja with rice black beans, green salad and tostones. AMAZING! finally we are having Cuban food here which is one of the best Latin food ever. 

We should have more of this than disgusting Mexican food.
